utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Before we get started, I’d like to announce the winner of our design your own flag competition. But I can’t. The only entry was from GameyGamer75, and I know that was a jpeg of your buttocks. Now this week we have a very special episode where we explore the flags of the popular entertainment franchise, Star Trek. And to help me, I’m pleased to introduce Internet personality, former star of Star Trek: The Next Generation, and the only guy I know lucky enough to be immortalized in one sixteenth scale. Set phasers to fun for my friend, Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. Thanks for having me. I’m happy to be here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Cut.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry, Sheldon, you were brilliant as always. Wil, that was a little wooden.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Wooden?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t worry, it wasn’t terrible. Just, this time, try to say it the way people sound. And action.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My friend, Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. Thanks for having me. I’m excited to be here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, Wil, what do you have for us first?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Well, this is an exciting one. This is the flag of the United Federation of Planets. Now what’s interesting about this flag…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Cut.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: What was wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s called Fun with Flags. They’re not at half-mast, nobody died. Let’s try and keep it upbeat.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Um, no offence, but I’ve been acting since I was a kid. I think I can handle a Web show without a lot of direction.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s true. In 1982, Wil played the voice of Martin the mouse in The Secret of NIMH. You moved me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’ll have to forgive me. This is my first time directing, I just want it to be good.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: So do I.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Great. So, this time let’s try more real boy, less Pinocchio. And action.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: And cut. You realize that I’m doing this for free, right?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes. And so far, we’re still not getting our money’s worth. Let’s try it again. Everybody’s having fun. And action.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, Wil, what do you have for us first?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Well, this is an exciting one. This is the flag of the United Federation of Planets.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Cut.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Problem, first-time director?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, none that I could see. I saw a man who loved flags almost as much as I do. I got goose bumps.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He was overacting on purpose.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? He reminded me of a young William Shatner.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Listen, Sheldon, I’m really happy to do this for you, but not if she’s gonna be a huge pain in the ass the whole time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You gonna let him speak to me like that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you’re my girlfriend and I don’t want you to be upset. Then again, Wil Wheaton’s my friend and I don’t want him to be upset. Hmm, this is a sticky wicket. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can I speak to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll be right back. Feel free to play with yourself.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t care for your friend, he’s being rude to me. You need to ask him to leave.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, I can’t just ask Wil Wheaton to leave. He’s a minor celebrity. Once you explain who he is, many people recognize him.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Fine. Then maybe I should go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Could you? That would solve everything. You are the best. I’ll see you at dinner tonight?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You sure you wouldn’t rather have dinner with your friend Wil Wheaton?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Come to think of it, I would! You, little lady, are on fire.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Every time we eat dinner here, your mother refuses to let me help with the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t take it personally. She likes doing them by herself so she can lick the plates with no one looking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, let me just grab a couple of fresh turtlenecks.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t understand why you keep your stuff here when there’s plenty of room at home.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you talking about? All I have here is a few sweaters, books, bank stuff, computers, mail, collectibles, medicine and my electric body groomer. Ooh, there’s my plaid dickie. Oh, got this at the Goodwill store for 50 cents. Can you believe it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: 50 cents sounds right. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, it’s kinda late. Why don’t we just spend the night here?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because we don’t live here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you? You said when you got back from space you were gonna move into my apartment, but half the time we stay here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, I’m doing laundry. You want me to put anything in for you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There’s some underwear in the hamper.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Oh, good, I got that new stain stick to try out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you, I only put it on the list two weeks ago. Okay, I see what you’re getting at. How about this weekend I’ll box up all my things and move them to our place.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The lightsabres are gonna look great in the living room.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Or in the closet. We can decide later.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, help, my hand’s stuck in the garbage disposal.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let go of whatever piece of food you’re holding.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Are you kidding? It’s a perfectly good chicken leg.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, look who’s out after dark, like a big boy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was out raising heck with Mr. Wil Wheaton. Four hours more and we would have closed down the HomeTown Buffet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you had plans with Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I did, but then Wil called Amy a pain in the A-S-S. She got huffy and left, then Wil and I headed out to dinner. That place really did remind me of my hometown. Because there we also have a HomeTown Buffet.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hold on. Wil and Amy had an argument?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, quite the kerfuffle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Then Amy got mad and left?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Walked right out the door.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Enjoyed a delightful dinner at a reasonable price. The manager recognized Wil and let us sit right next to the frozen yoghurt machine. Right next to it. I was closer to it than I am to you right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Buddy, I think Amy might be upset.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why’s that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because your friend was rude to her, and then you went to dinner with him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re just repeating what I said. It’s like living with a lactose-intolerant parrot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Trust me, call her.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. It’s a shame you didn’t go to dinner with us, because the buffet you’re about to enjoy only serves humble pie, a dessert much less tasty than frozen yoghurt. I was this close.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on skype)
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’ll appreciate this. Leonard has some ridiculous notion that you’re mad at me. Tell him you’re not mad at me. Go ahead, set him straight.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m mad at you, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm. Eat one of your Luna bars. Very often when women think they’re angry, they’re really just hungry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not hungry. Your friend insulted me, and you didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Precisely, I didn’t do anything. Now does someone feel like checking her emotional math?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Keep going, buddy, you’re doing great.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m your girlfriend, and you should have taken my side. That’s it. End of story. Good night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow, Amy’s mad and Leonard was right. What a weird day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Sorry this took so long. But you used to work here, you know how it is.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Kitchen slammed again?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, I’m a terrible waitress, remember?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, is there anything I can do to help you with the move tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now that you mention it, I was thinking tomorrow might not be great.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s your excuse this time?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No excuse. It’s just, you know, I’m Jewish, and technically, we’re not supposed to drive or carry anything on the Sabbath. So this one’s on God.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That might be a little more convincing if you didn’t have a mouthful of bacon cheeseburger.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My religion’s kinda loosey-goosey. Basically, as long as you got your schmekel clipped and don’t wear a cross, you’re good.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, you promised you’d move.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And I will.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I will. I’m obviously not going to live in my mother’s house for the rest of my life. I’m not a child.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ve seen her burp you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She did not burp me. She was patting me on the back, and I happened to burp. Don’t you have other tables you should be waiting on?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, but I told you, I’m not good at my job. Bernadette, listen to me. He is never gonna leave.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m starting to think you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, I’ve had enough of this. I’m a grown man, I have a successful career, for the love of God, I’ve been to space. I will move out when I’m ready, and I don’t need anyone badgering me into it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That was just for her benefit. I’ll move tomorrow. I love you. Don’t leave me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy. Amy. Angry Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about what happened, and I hope this gift will make things better.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Star Trek DVDs? Why would I want this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: First of all, you’re welcome. And furthermore, not being familiar with Wil Wheaton’s body of work, there was no way for you to know you were being rude to a national treasure. Get ready for 130 hours of I told you so. Fine. I’ll just tell you what happens. Episode one, Encounter at Farpoint. Fade in. The new Enterprise heads out on its maiden voyage to contact the Bandi people of Deneb IV. Enter Wesley Crusher, played by my buddy… She’s hooked.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow. An end of an era.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Boy, if these walls could talk.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’d say, why does he touch himself so much?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I can’t believe I’m not going to live here anymore. This has always been my bedroom. Right here is where my mom used to mark my height.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Fifth grade. Sixth grade. Seventh grade. Eighth grade. Ninth grade.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I remember when I was five, hiding under this desk with all my Halloween candy. Had some Peanut M_M’S, went into my first anaphylactic shock and had to be rushed to the hospital. Came home, celebrated with a Snickers, went into my second anaphylactic shock.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: When did you figure out you were allergic to nuts?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sometime around the third Almond Joy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. You want to start loading this stuff into the truck?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess. Hey, would you do me a favour? Go on ahead. I just want one last moment alone in my old room.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not standing outside by the U-Haul while you fondle yourself.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. What brings you in?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, if you wouldn’t mind, I’d like to have a conversation about girls.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I had a feeling we’d have a talk like this sooner or later. Are you finally getting fuzz in weird places?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, please, I’m on the horns of a relationship dilemma. And for the record, I had a full pubis of hair by the time I was 19.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And for the record, bleugh. So what are you drinking?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it’s been a rough day. I usually go chamomile tea, but I don’t think that’s going to cut it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You could have a Long Island Iced Tea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will that calm my nerves?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s calmed the pants off me a couple of times.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sold.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. So, the heart you got from the wizard giving you trouble?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The trouble isn’t with me, Penny, it’s with your gender. Someday, scientists will discover that second X chromosome contains nothing but nonsense and twaddle.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, Amy told me what happened. Look, just apologize. It’ll warm her twaddle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s a Band-Aid at best. See, the core problem is that Amy and Wil do not like each other. Which is baffling because they’re both crazy about me. And I like them, which indicates they’re bright and interesting and/or were on Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Honey, you can’t make people like each other.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not true. Leonard made me like you. And let me tell you, that was a hard row to hoe. Cheers, pal. Ooh. Boy, that is a treat that’s hard to beat. Get the Mad Hatter on the horn, I’m having a tea party.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You might want to pace yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I drink tea all the time. I think I know what I’m doing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Far be it from me to criticize a man with a full pubis. Look, Sheldon, your problem is not Wil Wheaton, okay? Your problem is the way you treated Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My problem is I’m out of tea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, someone insulted your girlfriend and you just let him do it. I thought you Texas guys stood up for your womenfolk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, please, I think I’ve evolved beyond my simple rustic upbringing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On the other hand, that low-down polecat done wronged my woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Welcome to Long Island, Tex.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy deserves better. You know, when we buy the Planter’s deluxe mix, she eats all the Brazil nuts so I don’t have to look at them. She’s a unique blend of saint and squirrel.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, that she is. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m a callous egomaniac. She’s gonna leave me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, she won’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, she won’t. I’m great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, I have now officially moved out of my mother’s house. You are now the only woman in my life who I’ll see naked in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know this wasn’t easy. You doing okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I’m fine. It’s just her I’m worried about.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw, she’ll be okay. She’s a grown woman.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. It’s just ever since my dad left, I’ve felt responsible for her.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s a lot for a kid to deal with.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She was just so sad all the time. I was the only person who could cheer her up. Well, me and Ben and Jerry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: She’s lucky you were there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, she’s why I first got into magic. I would do little shows for her, hang up a bedsheet like it was a curtain, put on a top hat and cape. And part way through the act, I would say I needed a volunteer from the audience to be my beautiful assistant and invite her up on stage. I can still remember the way she’d smile. For a few minutes, she’d forget how lonely she was.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw, crap. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Where we going?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Grab a box. We’ll sleep at your mother’s place tonight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, but I want to live here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, you should’ve thought of that before you told me the stupid magic trick story.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can’t we talk about this?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No husband of mine is gonna break his mother’s heart!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wil Wheaton! Wil Wheaton! Wait, how many was that?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wouldn’t you like to know?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Have you been drinking?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just tea. S’the best tea I’ve ever had.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you. I’m from Texas. Need I say more?

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Yeah, actually, a little more would be helpful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You insulted my woman. I’m here to defend her honour. Two! It was two. Wil Wheaton! Now prepare yourself for what may come.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon, do you really think we’re gonna fight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My fists are not up here because I’m milking a giant invisible cow. They’re up to beat an apology out of you.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that was a long bus ride for not very much.

utterance.speaker: Wil
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re asking a lot of questions, Wil Wheaton. As a matter of idle curiosity, which of your shrubberies do you feel would benefit from a thorough vomiting? Never mind, I’ll choose. You were so good in Stand by Me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Welcome to Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Get ready for a very special episode where we explore the flags of the popular entertainment franchise, Star Trek. And to help us, I’m pleased to introduce a special guest, surprisingly, it only took gas money and the promise of free food to get him here, Mr. LeVar Burton.

utterance.speaker: LeVar
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, it’s a pleasure to be here. Well, we’ve got some interesting flags for…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Cut. Yikes, this guy is worse than Wil Wheaton.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know what she’s talking about, but I’m obligated to agree with her. She’s my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: LeVar
utterance.content: Ah, I hear you, brother. I still get lunch, right?
